report_title: Industry Report on Custom Screen Printing
executive_summary: Companies in the Custom Screen Printing industry use screen printing services on a job-order basis. Printing services include customized stationary, invitations, labels and apparel, like T-shirts, to a broad spectrum of downstream buyers. Industry revenue has declined alongside the more significant declines in the broader Printing industry (IBISWorld Report 32311). Falling revenue can be attributed to ongoing reductions in print advertising expenditure and the adverse effects of the COVID-19 pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Bright Spot for Custom Screen Printers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry generates nearly half its revenue from printing on garments and textiles through orders for custom T-shirts, uniform printing and other consumer-facing services. Economic improvements, revenue growth in the latter half of the period will not offset the pandemic-related decline. Industry revenue has been falling at an average annualized 2.6% over the past five years and is expected to total $9.5 billion in 2023, when revenue will rise by an estimated 0.4%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Downstream Demand Will Increase Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry generates substantial revenue from contracts to print consumer packaging. Demand for packaging and labels is determined mainly by domestic manufacturing activity. As consumer spending has risen, manufacturers have received more orders and exhibited greater demand for industry services related to the packaging of their goods.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: New Competitors Are Dragging Down Profit Margins
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rising industry participation has placed downward pressure on industry prices, as most businesses are nonemployers catering to localized markets and primarily compete based on merit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Consumer Income Will Encourage More Spending
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The custom apparel industry is poised to benefit significantly from rising per capita disposable income. As people have more discretionary income, they are more able to spend on non-essential items, such as custom-made clothing. An increase in corporate profit provides companies with a larger spending capacity. As yields rise, companies often look to reinvest in their growth. Customized promotional materials and strategic marketing efforts are critical areas of investment.

Printing services related to product packaging, which represent a small but substantial share of industry sales, will be challenged by increased offshoring activity. The industry will continue to be threatened by paperless trends like virtual invites. The percentage of online businesses will swell, reducing demand for services previously performed by custom screen printers. Declining print advertising expenditure will accelerate, weakening demand from advertisers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Shifting Industry Trends as Consumer Look for Alternative Services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the screen printing industry continues to evolve and mature, a faster pace of industry consolidation is expected. Screen printers are predicted to intensify their strategic acquisitions and mergers to expand their market share. Revenue increases for custom screen printing businesses will likely decline because of a reduction in print advertising expenditure as marketing trends shift towards digital platforms. Industry employment is expected to decline, contributing to nominal growth in new companies and a more significant share of online industry services, reducing the need for employees to conduct in-person sales.

industry_definition: Operators in the Custom Screen Printing industry engage in screen printing without publishing on a job-order basis. Printing services include, but are not limited to, stationary, invitations, labels and apparel such as T-shirts, caps, jackets and towels.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady Barriers To Entry Level

key_trends: The industry has significantly outperformed the broader printing sector. Its lesser reliance on declining print media and advertising markets makes companies less resilient.

The industry was greatly affected by reduced consumer spending. Social distancing policies implemented during the pandemic largely prevented large gatherings, like sporting games, fundraisers or concerts, where customized merchandise is often available.
Companies must abide by environmental laws. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) regulates hazardous material use, handling and disposal to safeguard public health and the environment.

The industry receives support from the Printing Industries of America (PIA). The PIA offers its members various services, including industry research, professional training and public policy advocacy.
Businesses often purchase bulk orders of customized apparel. These businesses are consumer-facing, like breweries, coffee shops or restaurants.

Industry products are sold directly to clients based on their desired specifications. Manufacturers of textiles use screen printing to add designs to their products are not considered part of the industry.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Manufacturers contract the industry to perform printing services on apparel or other products and demand packaging.
Marketing departments contract the industry for apparel printing for brand-building rather than resale.
Other sources of industry demand include consumers, federal and state government agencies and nonprofit organizations.

products_and_services.product_description: The process of screen printing on apparel items, like T-shirts, sweatshirts or hats, is a multi-step process purchased by businesses and consumers for various purposes.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Stationery, Invitations and Other Paper-based Printing
products_and_services.product_description: Companies in this industry produce customized screen print paper products, like custom letterheads, business cards and invitations.
Companies in this industry also print other items, like calendars, yearbooks and atlases, among many others.
This segment caters to the manufacturing sector, which sometimes contracts companies for printing services related to the production of consumer packaging.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: APPAREL PRINTING KEEPS SELLING IN BULK
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Customized screen printing services produce custom apparel for concerts, sporting events, camps and fundraisers.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: STATIONERY, INVITATIONS AND OTHER PAPER-BASED PRINTING ARE DIMINISHING AS ONLINE SUBSTITUTES DOMINATE
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The rising popularity of online substitutes, like electronic invitations, has decreased this segment as a revenue share.

Labels are commonly created for food, beverage and personal care markets. They're crucial in these downstream markets as they provide information about product ingredients, nutritional value, usage instructions and any warnings or precautions.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Printing of Simple Materials is Turning to Online Services
demand_determinants.determinant_description: With the increasing popularity of online services, traditional bricks-and-mortar stores have witnessed significant declines in the sales of numerous products.

business_locations.location_description: There is a growing trend toward sustainability and eco-friendliness, which has resulted in a rise in demand for products and printing methods that are friendly to the environment.
The popularity of personalization and customization trends in the United States has increased the need for custom screen-printing services.
The Great Lakes region's high population density and thriving business scene make it an ideal market for showcasing and selling custom screen-printed products.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) oversees these hazardous materials' use, handling and disposal to protect public health and environmental quality.

The Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) provides minimum wage, overtime pay, recordkeeping and youth employment standards. The Occupational Safety and Health Act (OSHA) focuses on employee safety rights in the workplace.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Custom screen printing typically requires a high level of expertise, which can be challenging to acquire for newcomers.
The business is profoundly work-concentrated, as companies must employ many workers to produce the necessary volume of products.

basis_points.basis_title: Cost and convenience prioritized by consumers
basis_points.basis_description: Consumers have put a premium on cost and convenience. The location of operators' stores affects the competitive landscape, with consumers opting for the practicality of nearby businesses.
Online offerings enable consumers to order products virtually, often at lower costs.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Because of the industry's highly competitive and localized nature, it is difficult for businesses to capture a significant market share.

While customizable apparel printing has faced strong demand from consumers compared with other printing segments, some websites offer instructions on how to screen print apparel, making suppliers' services less essential for less innovative or detailed projects.
Custom screen printing like calendars, yearbooks, periodicals and invitations is getting digitized, making it challenging for businesses to increase their revenue as the physical need reduces.
A lack of demand for products can hamper business expansion and growth. Without customer interest and purchasing power, businesses cannot scale up or enhance product lines to increase profitability.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases remain high as printers require many inputs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The primary inputs companies use include paper, ink, film, offset plates, chemicals and cartons, and various inventory for screen printing, like T-shirts, hats or promotional items.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Screen printers order inventory on an as-needed basis
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Screen printers order inventory on an as-needed basis to reduce carrying costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Workers are required to attract demand and maintain customers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The screen-printing industry is predominantly labor-intensive. Companies require a significant workforce for diverse roles, including the manual screen-printing procedure, sales and administrative tasks, reflecting the necessity of human resources in this sector.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Custom screen printing typically requires a high level of expertise, which can be challenging to acquire for newcomers. The business is profoundly work-concentrated, as companies must employ many workers to produce the necessary volume of products.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Disruptions in the Supply Chain Draw Uncertainty
volatility_points.volatility_description: Global supply chains were significantly disrupted by the COVID-19 pandemic, which affected the availability of screen printing equipment and raw materials.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Changes in the Way People Think
volatility_points.volatility_description: In response to the pandemic, consumer behavior has significantly changed, increasing online shopping and product customization.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Import penetration in the industry is very low, due to the industry's focus on manufacturing custom orders.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Many printers have expanded into ancillary creative services as demand for printed material has declined.

FAQs.question: Has your company located in proximity to its key downstream distributors to reduce shipping costs?
FAQs.answer: In certain segments, such as packaging printing, industry companies benefit by being close to manufacturing markets.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Screen printing is a fairly traditional method that has undergone little change.

FAQs.question: How does your company invest in technology, such as 3D printing, to establish a competitive edge over your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Screen printing is a fairly traditional method that has undergone little change.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Software has simplified design processes, but labor intensity remains high.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: The industry is minimally regulated outside of basic occupational health and safety standards.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: The industry will not face substantial environmental regulation, but environmentally friendly printing methods may attract customers.

FAQs.question: How frequently does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: Capital costs are relatively high in the industry because printers regularly invest in new equipment.

FAQs.question: What challenges does your company face financing its ongoing operations?
FAQs.answer: The printing subsector in general is operating with excess capacity, which depresses prices and makes it difficult for printers to cover fixed costs.

FAQs.question: How much do you invest in marketing? What consumer segments does your company target?
FAQs.answer: Given the high level of competition, marketing expertise can be important to an operator's success.

FAQs.question: How does your company recruit the best employees? Do you offer competitive wages?
FAQs.answer: Given the shortage of skilled tradespeople in the Printing industry, operators that can ensure an adequate labor supply have a distinct market advantage.

FAQs.question: What new technological systems have you put in place to increase efficiency? Is your website easy to use for consumers?
FAQs.answer: New technology can improve efficiency, reduce labor costs and improve product quality. Players that use technology to their advantage enhance their competitiveness.

FAQs.question: Have you used online platforms to better reach your customers? Have you experienced reduced demand as connectivity rises?
FAQs.answer: As internet coverage continues to expand, an increasing number of consumers will have access to custom screen printing sites. However, digitization also generally reduces demand for printed materials.

FAQs.question: Does your revenue trend in line with corporate profit levels? What percentage of your revenue is derived from corporate clients?
FAQs.answer: Businesses are more likely to order custom apparel and other screen-printed goods when profit is growing. Conversely, businesses are more likely to cut nonessential spending, such as branded merchandise purchases, when profit is shrinking.

FAQs.question: Has your revenue risen in line with disposable income levels? What value-added products and services do you offer when income is high?
FAQs.answer: When disposable income increases, consumers are more likely to purchase custom screen printing services. When disposable income decreases, consumers instead become more likely to put off discretionary purchases, such as screen printing services.
